intro: Varronia leucocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered varronia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Varronia leucocalyx is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
